Add copyable profile view panel
description:
Add a panel that displays the user's profile information in an easy-to-copy format for manual entry.

**Problem:**
Users sometimes need to manually fill fields that the extension can't auto-fill. Currently, they must switch to the Options page or their resume document to reference information.

**Proposed Solution:**
Add a "View Profile" panel that displays all profile information in a clean, copyable format.

**Design Options to Consider:**
1. **Location:** Popup tab/section OR standalone page OR expand in options page
2. **Format:** Plain text list, formatted sections, or copy buttons per field
3. **Sections:** Personal Info, Work History, Education, Skills (matching existing structure)

**Suggested Implementation:**
- Add "View Profile" button in popup
- Show formatted profile in modal or separate view
- Include individual copy buttons for each field
- Display work history in chronological order with all details
- Option to copy entire section or individual fields

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- User can view all profile data in one place
- Easy to copy individual fields or entire sections
- No need to switch between extension pages
- Clean, readable formatting
- Accessible from popup for quick reference

**Technical Considerations:**
- May need new HTML page or expand popup
- Consider responsive design for different screen sizes
- Preserve line breaks and formatting in textareas
- Handle empty/missing fields gracefully
close_reason: Implementation complete. Added copyable profile view panel within popup with individual copy buttons for all fields.

title: Add collapse button at bottom of accordion sections
description:
Currently, accordion sections in work experience and education can only be collapsed by clicking the header. For long entries with lots of content, users have to scroll back up to the header to collapse the section.

Add a collapse button at the bottom of each expanded accordion section so users can close it without scrolling back to the top. This improves UX especially for entries with long descriptions.

Implement failed field highlighting and skip logic
description:
Implement session-based tracking of failed form fields with:
- Skip Logic: Fields that fail are skipped for the rest of THIS fill session only
- Persistent Highlighting: Failed fields remain highlighted (red) until user interacts with them
- Manual Reset: 'Reset Failed Fields' button in popup to clear tracking

Implementation complete:
✅ DOM utility functions (generateFieldId, highlightFailedField, removeFailedHighlights)
✅ Content script state management (failedFieldIds Set, accessor functions)
✅ Form filler skip logic (check before filling, track failures)
✅ Popup UI (failed count badge, reset button)
✅ CSS styles (warning button, failed fields badge)
✅ Build successful

Ready for testing and deployment.
close_reason: Implementation complete. All code changes made, build successful. Feature tested in development.

description:
Remove the PDF parsing feature from the extension. Users will need to manually enter their profile information instead of uploading a resume PDF.

This includes:
- Removing PDF.js dependencies
- Removing resume parser code
- Removing PDF upload UI from options page
- Removing PARSE_RESUME message handling
- Cleaning up unused dependencies from package.json and webpack config

title: Implement section detection algorithm for resumes
Convert profile view to use Side Panel API
description:
Convert the recently implemented profile view from popup expansion to Chrome Side Panel API.

**Why Side Panel:**
- More screen space for profile display
- Can stay open while user navigates pages
- Better UX for reference material
- Follows Chrome's design patterns

**Current Implementation:**
- Profile view expands within popup (320px width)
- Replaces popup content with profile view state

**New Implementation:**
- Side panel (separate page) opens when 'View Profile' clicked
- Stays open while user fills forms manually
- Better for long profiles with lots of work experience

**Files to Modify:**
- manifest.json: Add side_panel declaration
- webpack.config.js: Add sidepanel entry point
- Create src/sidepanel/ directory with sidepanel.html, sidepanel.js, sidepanel.css
- src/popup/popup.js: Change viewProfileButton to open side panel
- src/popup/popup.html: Remove profile-view-state (or keep as fallback)

**Benefits:**
- More space for profile data
- Can reference while filling forms
- Better multi-tasking UX

description:
The work experience section in the side panel can still be hard to navigate when there are many entries. Consider implementing one of these solutions:
- Accordion-style expand/collapse for each work entry (show header, expand to see details)
- Pagination within the work experience tab
- Virtual scrolling for better performance with many entries
- Summary view with expand buttons for full details
